name: src/CompileError.js
CompileError
description: Any error thrown by the compiler due to a problem with the input source code.

name: warning
description: Location and description of the error.

name: Warning
description:
Any problem with source code.
Despite the name, this is used for both warnings and errors.

name: loc
description: Source location of the problem.

name: message
description: Text description of the problem.

name: messageParts
description: Applies `codeFormatter` to parts of `this.message` created by {@link code}.

return.description:
Generator yielding strings (for non-`code`)
and results of `formatter(code)` for `code` parts.

name: code
description: Used when generating warning messages to highlight a part of that message.

name: src/Compiler.js

params.name: options.indent
params.description:
Mason does not allow mixed kinds of indentation,
so indent type must be set once here and used consistently.
If '\t', use tabs to indent.
If a Number, indent with that many spaces. Should be an int 2 through 8.

params.name: options.mslPath
params.description: Path to `msl`. This may be `msl/dist`.

params.name: options.checks
params.description: If false, leave out type checks and assertions.

params.name: options.includeSourceMap
params.description: See @return for description.

params.name: options.importBoot
params.description:
Most mason modules include `msl/private/boot`, which `msl`.
If you don't want to do this, much of the language will not work.
This is only intended for compiling `msl` itself.

params.name: source
params.description: Mason source code for a single module.

params.name: filename
params.description: Path of the source file.

types: {warnings: Array<Warning>, result: CompileError | {code: string, sourceMap: string}}
return.description:
`CompileError`s are not thrown, but returned.
This allows us to return `warnings` as well.
`sourceMap` will be empty unless `opts.includeSourceMap`.

name: parse
description:
Return a {@link MsAst} rather than transpiling it to JavaScript.
Parameters are the same as `compile`.

name: CompileError
description:
Get the CompileError class associated with this compiler.
This is used by mason-node-util to avoid depending on mason-compile directly.

name: src/info.js
keywords
description:
Array of the names of every keyword, not including reserved words.
Alphabetically sorted.

name: reservedKeywords
description:
Array of the names of every reserved word.
Alphabetically sorted.

name: src/private/CompileOptions.js
CompileOptions
description:
Stores `opts` parameter to compile methods and supplies defaults.
See {@link compile} for description of options.

name: src/private/MsAst.js
MsAst
description:
Any Mason AST.
All ASTs have a `loc` that they pass on to the esast during {@link transpile}.

name: LineContent
description:
Any valid part of a Block.
Note that some {@link Val}s will still cause warnings if they appear as a line.

name: Do
description: Can only appear as lines in a Block.

name: Val
description: Can appear in any expression.

name: Module
description: Whole source file.

name: name
description: Not used for compilation, but useful for tools.

name: ImportDo
description: Single import in an `import!` block.

name: Import
description:
Single import in an `import` block.
If path is 'global', this is transpiled specially because there's no actual 'global' module.

name: LocalDeclare
description:
All {@link LocalAccess}es must have some LocalDeclare to access.
All accessible identifiers are therefore LocalDeclares.
This includes imports, `this`, the focus, etc.

name: untyped
description: LocalDeclare with no type.

name: plain
description: LocalDeclare of just a name.

name: LocalDeclares
description: Kind of {@link LocalDeclare}.

name: LocalAccess
description: Access the local `name`.

name: LocalMutate
description: `{name} := {value}`

name: Assign
description: Any expression creating new locals.

name: allAssignees
description: All locals created by the assign.

name: AssignSingle
description: `{assignee} =/:=/::= {value}`

name: focus
description: Assign to `_`.

name: AssignDestructure
description: `{assignees} =/:=/::= {value}`

name: kind
description: Kind of locals this assigns to.

name: Setters
description: Kinds of {@link MemberSet} and {@link SetSub}.

name: MemberSet
description:
`{object}.{name}:{opType} =/:=/::= {value}`
Also handles `{object}."{name}"`.

name: SetSub
description: `{object}[{subbeds}]:{opType} =/:=/::= {value}`

name: Throw
description: `throw! {opThrown}`

name: Assert
description: `assert!/forbid! {condition} throw! {opThrown}`

name: negate
description: If true, this is a `forbid!`.

name: condition
description: Compiled specially if a {@link Call}.

name: Except
opCatchAll
description: opCatchAll.caught should have no type.

name: Catch
description:
```catch {caught}
{block}```

name: Block
description: Lines in an indented block.

name: BuildEntry
description: Part of a builder.

name: ObjEntry
description: Part of a {@link BlockObj}.

name: ObjEntryAssign
description:
`a. b`
ObjEntry that produces a new local.

name: ObjEntryPlain
description: ObjEntry that does not introduce a new local.

name: access
description:
`{name}.` with no value.
Takes a local of the same name from outside.

name: BagEntry
description: `. {value}` or `... {value}`

name: MapEntry
description: `key` -> `val`

name: Conditional
description:
```if/unless {test}
{result}```

name: Cond
description: `cond {test} {ifTrue} {ifFalse}`

name: Fun
description:
```|:{opDeclareRes} {args} ...{opRestArg}
{block}```

name: Funs
description: Kinds of {@link Fun}.

name: Await
description: `$ {value} `

name: Yield
description: `yield {opValue}`

name: YieldTo
description: `yield* {value}`

name: Class
ClassKindDo
description: `do!` part of {@link Class} or {@link Kind}.

name: Constructor
description: `construct! {fun}`

name: MethodImplLike
description: Any part of {@link Class.statics} or {@link Class.methods}.

name: isMy
description: Used by tools.

name: MethodImpl
description: `{symbol} {fun}`

name: MethodGetter
description:
```get {symbol}
{block}```

name: MethodSetter
description:
```set {symbol}
{block}```

name: SuperCall
description:
`super {args}`.
Never a {@link SuperMember}.

name: SuperMember
description: `super.{name}` or `super."{name}"`.

name: Call
description: `{called} {args}`

name: contains
description: `{tested}:{testType}`

name: sub
description: `{subbed}[{args}]`

name: delSub
description: `del! {subbed}[{args}]`

name: New
description: `new {type} {args}`

name: Spread
description: `...{spreaded}`

name: Lazy
description: `~{value}`

name: Case
description: `case`

name: opCased
description: Assignee is always a LocalDeclareFocus.

name: CasePart
description: Single case in a {@link Case}.

name: Pattern
description: `:{type} {locals}`

name: Switch
description: `switch`

name: SwitchPart
description:
Single case in a {@link Switch}.
Multiple values are specified with `or`.

name: For
description: `for`

name: ForAsync
description: ```$for {opIteratee}

name: ForBag
description:
`@for`
Contains many {@link BagEntry} and {@link BagEntryMany}.

name: Iteratee
description: `x in y` or just `y` (where the local is implicitly `_`).

name: Break
description: `break`

name: BlockWrap
description:
A block appearing on its own (not as the block to an `if` or the like)
is put into one of these.
e.g.:
x =
y = 1
y

name: BagSimple
description: One-line @ expression, such as `[ 1 2 3 ]`.

name: ObjSimple
description: One-line object expression, such as `(a. 1 b. 2)`.

name: ObjPair
description: Part of an {@link ObjSimple}.

name: Logic
description: `and` or `or` expression.

name: Logics
description: Kinds of {@link Logic}.

name: Not
description: `not` keyword

name: NumberLiteral
description:
Literal number value.
This is both a Token and MsAst.

name: value
description: Store as a string so we can distinguish `0xf` and `15`.

name: Member
description: `{object}.{name}` or `{object}."{name}"`.

name: name
description: If a string, could still be any string, so may still compile to `a['string']`.

name: MsRegExp
description:
RegExp expression, like `\`foo\``..
Like QuotePlain, may contain interpolation.

name: flags
description: Some selection of the letters in 'gimy' (in that order).

name: QuoteAbstract
description: {@link Quote} or {@link QuoteSimple}.

name: QuotePlain
description:
Quoted text. Always compiles to a template string.
For tagged templates, use {@link QuoteTaggedTemplate}.

name: parts
description:
`parts` are Strings interleaved with Vals.
part Strings are raw values, meaning "\n" is two characters.

name: QuoteTaggedTemplate
description: `{tag}"{quote}"`

name: QuoteSimple
description:
`'{name}`.
Quote consisting of a single name.

name: Pipe
description:
```pipe {value}
{pipes}```

name: With
description:
```with {value} [as {declare}]
{block}```

name: MemberFun
description: `&{name}` or `.&{name}` or `{object}.&{name}`

name: GetterFun
description: `&.{name}`

name: SimpleFun
description: `&({value})`

name: Range
description: `{start}..{end}` or `{start}...{end}`.

name: end
description: If null, this is an infinite Range.

name: SpecialDo
description:
A special action.
All SpecialDos are atomic and do not rely on context.

name: SpecialDos
description: Kinds of {@link SpecialDo}.

name: SpecialVal
description:
A special expression.
All SpecialVals are atomic and do not rely on context.

name: SpecialVals
description: Kinds of {@link SpecialVal}.

name: Ignore
description:
`ignore` statement.
Keeps the compiler from complaining about an unused local.

name: src/private/PathOptions.js
src/private/Token.js
Token
description:
Lexed element in a tree of Tokens.
Since {@link lex} does grouping, {@link parse} avoids doing much of the work parsers usually do;
it doesn't have to handle a "left parenthesis", only a {@link Group} of kind G_Parenthesis.
This also means that the many different {@link MsAst} types all parse in a similar manner,
keeping the language consistent.
Besides {@link Group}, {@link Keyword}, {@link Name}, and {@link DocComment},
{@link NumberLiteral} values are also treated as Tokens.

name: Group
description:
Contains multiple sub-tokens.
See {@link GroupKind} for explanations.

name: subTokens
description: Tokens within this group.

name: Keyword
description:
A "keyword" is any set of characters with a particular meaning.
It doensn't necessarily have to be something that might have been a {@link Name}.
For example, see {@link Keywords.ObjEntry}.
This can even include ones like `. ` (defines an object property, as in `key. value`).
Kind is a ***. See the full list below.

name: Name
description:
An identifier. Usually the name of some local variable or property.
A Name is guaranteed to not be any keyword.

name: DocComment
description:
Documentation comment (beginning with one `|` rather than two).
Non-doc comments are ignored by {@link lex}.
These don't affect output, but are passed to various {@link MsAst}s for use by other tools.

name: Groups
description: Kinds of {@link Group}.

name: showGroupKind
description: Outputtable description of a group kind.

name: Keywords
description: Kinds of {@link Keyword}.

name: keywordName
description: Name of a keyword.

name: opKeywordKindFromName
description: See if the name is a keyword and if so return its kind.

name: isGroup
description: Whether `token` is a Group of the given kind.

name: isKeyword
description: Whether `token` is a Keyword of the given kind.

name: isAnyKeyword
description: Whether `token` is a Keyword of any of the given kinds.

name: isNameKeyword
description: Whether `token` is a Keyword whose value can be used as a property name.

name: isReservedKeyword
description: Whether `token` is a reserved word.

name: src/private/VerifyResults.js
VerifyResults
description:
Results of {@link verify}.
This is only the data needed by {@link transpile}.

name: localAccessToDeclare
description:
LocalAccess -> LocalDeclare.
Needed because lazy accesses must be compiled differently.

name: localDeclareToAccesses
description:
LocalDeclare -> Array[LocalAccess].
Debug locals will not be output if not in debug mode.

name: names
description:
Maps Class/Fun to name if one is appropriate.
Maps *every* {@link SpecialVals.Name} to the nearest name.

name: builtinPathToNames
description:
String -> Set.
For each path, the names of each builtin imported.
Like the inverse of context.opts.builtinNameToPath,
but only includes names actually used.

name: superCallToMethod
description: Values are either MethodImpl or the string 'constructor'

name: constructorToSuper
description: Links a constructor to its super! call.

name: blockToKind
description: Stores verified block kind (see verifyBlock.js)

name: statements
description:
Set of MsAsts that have been marked as being statements.
Those which are always statements (like Throw) are not marked.
Use a set of statements because there are usually many more vals than statements.

name: objEntryExports
description: ObjEntry_s that are module exports

name: loopsNeedingLabel
description: Set of {@link Loop}s with at least one {@link Break} in a {@link Switch}.

name: breaksInSwitch
description: Set of {@link Break}s that are inside {@link Switch}es.

name: localDeclareForAccess
description: Gets the LocalDeclare that was verified to be the one accessed.

name: name
description: Get closest assignment name to an expression.

name: opName
description:
Get closest assignment name to an expression,
or `null` if none is available.

name: isStatement
description: Certain expressions (such as `if`) are marked if they are statements.

name: blockKind
description: What kind of block the verifier determined this to be.

name: isObjEntryExport
description: Whether an ObjEntry is a module export.

name: loopNeedsLabel
description: Whether some `break` in this loop is in a `switch`.

name: isBreakInSwitch
description: Returns whether there is a `switch` in between this `break` and its loop.

name: Blocks
description: Kinds of {@link Block}.

name: Modules
description: Kinds of {@link Module}.

name: src/private/context.js
setContext
description:
Write to {@link options} and {@link warnings}.
Remember to call {@link unsetContext}!

name: unsetContext
description: Release {@link options} and {@link warnings} for garbage collection.

name: check
description:
If `cond` is false, {@link fail}.
`loc` and `message` may also be Functions to to get them lazily.

name: fail
description:
Throw a {@link CompileError}.
Parameters are the same as for {@link warn}.

name: warn
description: Add a new warning.

params.name: message
params.description: Will often contain sequences created by {@link code}.

name: src/private/defaultBuiltins.js
content:
export default {
	global: [
		// Standard globals
		'Array',
		'Boolean',
		'console',
		'Date',
		'Error',
		'Function',
		'Intl',
		'JSON',
		'Promise',
		'Proxy',
		'Math',
		'Number',
		'Object',
		'Reflect',
		'RegExp',
		'SIMD',
		'String',
		'Symbol',

		// Errors
		'EvalError',
		'InternalError',
		'RangeError',
		'ReferenceError',
		'SyntaxError',
		'TypeError',
		'URIError',

		// ArrayBuffer and views
		'ArrayBuffer',
		'DataView',
		'Float32Array',
		'Float64Array',
		'Int16Array',
		'Int32Array',
		'Int8Array',
		'Uint16Array',
		'Uint32Array',
		'Uint8Array',
		'Uint8ClampedArray',

		// URI functions
		'decodeURI',
		'decodeURIComponent',
		'encodeURI',
		'encodeURIComponent'

		// Missing globals:
		// eval: Want to discourage use
		// isFinite, isNaN, parseFloat, parseInt: use Number.xxx functions
		// Map, Set: have different meanings for msl. Use Id-Map and Id-Set for native versions.
		// WeakMap, WeakSet: use Weak-Id-Map and Weak-Id-Set
	],
	'msl.@.?': [
		'_',
		'?None',
		'Opt->?',
		'?->Opt',
		'?-or',
		'?-cond',
		'?some',
		'un-?'
	],
	'msl.@.@': [
		'_',
		'++',
		'++~',
		'+!',
		'++!',
		'--',
		'--~',
		'-!',
		'--!',
		'all?',
		'any?',
		'count',
		'each!',
		'empty?',
		'empty!',
		'?find',
		'fold',
		'@flat-map',
		'@flat-map~',
		'@flatten',
		'@flatten~',
		'iterator',
		'@keep',
		'@keep~',
		'@map',
		'@map~'
	],
	'msl.@.@-Type': ['empty'],
	'msl.@.Map.Id-Map': ['_'],
	'msl.@.Map.Hash-Map': ['_'],
	'msl.@.Map.Map': [
		'_',
		'?get',
		'@keys',
		'make-map',
		'map=?',
		'@values'
	],
	'msl.@.Range': ['_'],
	'msl.@.Seq.Seq': [
		'_',
		'+>!',
		'@drop',
		'@drop~',
		'@drop-while',
		'@drop-while~',
		'first',
		'?first',
		'@indexes',
		'last',
		'?last',
		'?nth',
		'@reverse',
		'@reverse~',
		'@rtail',
		'@slice',
		'@slice~',
		'@split',
		'@split~',
		'seq=?',
		'@tail',
		'@take',
		'@take~',
		'@take-while',
		'@take-while~',
		'@zip',
		'@zip~'
	],
	'msl.@.Seq.Stream': ['_'],
	'msl.@.Set.Id-Set': ['_'],
	'msl.@.Set.Set': ['_', 'set=?'],
	'msl.compare': [
		'=?',
		'<?',
		'<=?',
		'>?',
		'>=?',
		'?min',
		'min',
		'?min-by',
		'min-by',
		'?max',
		'max',
		'?max-by',
		'max-by',
		'same?'
	],
	'msl.Function': ['Action', 'identity'],
	'msl.js': [
		'defined?',
		'id=?',
		'null?'
	],
	'msl.math.methods': ['+', '-', '*', '/'],
	'msl.math.Number': [
		'divisible?',
		'Int',
		'int/',
		'log-base',
		'modulo',
		'nearest-ceil',
		'nearest-floor',
		'nearest-round',
		'Nat',
		'remainder',
		'square'
	],
	'msl.math.util': ['average', 'sum'],
	'msl.methods': ['sub', 'set-sub!', 'del-sub!'],
	'msl.to-string': ['_', 'inspect'],
	'msl.Type.Method': ['_', 'impl!', 'impl-for', 'self-impl!'],
	'msl.Type.Kind': ['_', 'kind!', 'self-kind!'],
	'msl.Type.Pred-Type': ['_', 'Any', 'ObjLit'],
	'msl.Type.Type': ['_', '=>', 'contains?', 'extract']
}

name: src/private/lex/chars.js
content:
import {code} from '../../CompileError'

export const Chars = {
	Ampersand: '&',
	Backslash: '\\',
	Backtick: '`',
	Bang: '!',
	Bar: '|',
	Caret: '^',
	Cash: '$',
	CloseBracket: ']',
	CloseParenthesis: ')',
	Colon: ':',
	Comma: ',',
	Dot: '.',
	Equal: '=',
	G: 'g',
	Hash: '#',
	Hyphen: '-',
	I: 'i',
	LetterB: 'b',
	LetterO: 'o',
	LetterX: 'x',
	M: 'm',
	N0: '0',
	N1: '1',
	N2: '2',
	N3: '3',
	N4: '4',
	N5: '5',
	N6: '6',
	N7: '7',
	N8: '8',
	N9: '9',
	Newline: '\n',
	Null: '\0',
	OpenBracket: '[',
	OpenParenthesis: '(',
	Percent: '%',
	Quote: '"',
	Semicolon: ';',
	Space: ' ',
	Star: '*',
	Tab: '\t',
	Tick: '\'',
	Tilde: '~',
	Y: 'y'
}
for (const key in Chars)
	Chars[key] = Chars[key].charCodeAt(0)

export function showChar(char) {
	return code(String.fromCharCode(char))
}

function charPred(chars, negate = false) {
	let src = 'switch(ch) {\n'
	for (let i = 0; i < chars.length; i = i + 1)
		src = `${src}case ${chars.charCodeAt(i)}: `
	src = `${src} return ${!negate}\ndefault: return ${negate}\n}`
	return Function('ch', src)
}

export const
	isDigit = charPred('0123456789'),
	isDigitBinary = charPred('01'),
	isDigitOctal = charPred('01234567'),
	isDigitHex = charPred('0123456789abcdef')

// Anything not explicitly reserved is a valid name character.
const reservedCharacters = '#%^\\;,'
export const isNameCharacter = charPred(`\`&()[]{}|:". \n\t${reservedCharacters}`, true)

name: src/private/lex/groupContext.js
closeInterpolationOrParenthesis
description:
Close a Groups.Interpolation or Groups.Parenthesis,
returning whether it was an interpolation.

name: src/private/lex/lex*.js
src/private/lex/lex.js
lex
description:
Lexes the source code into {@link Token}s.
The Mason lexer also groups tokens as part of lexing.
This makes writing a recursive-descent parser easy.
See {@link Group}.

return.description: Block token representing the whole module.

name: src/private/lex/lexName.js
lexName
description: This is called *after* having eaten the first character of the name.

params.name: startPos
params.description: Position of first character.

params.name: isInterpolation
params.description: Whether this is a quote interpolation name like `#foo`.

name: src/private/lex/lexPlain.js
src/private/lex/lexQuote.js
src/private/lex/loadLex*.js
content:
// TODO:ES6 Recursive modules should work, so this should not be necessary.

import lexQuote from './lexQuote'
import {load} from './lex*'

load({lexQuote})

name: src/private/lex/sourceContext.js
src/private/manglePath.js
manglePath
description: Some Mason modules have names that don't work as URl paths.

name: src/private/parse/Slice.js
Slice
description:
Represents a slice of the `subTokens` of some {@link Group}.
This is just a view of it, so taking e.g. {@link tail} is O(1).
Most parser functions act on a Slice and call other functions on sub-slices.

name: group
description: Slice representing all subTokens of a {@link Group}.

name: _tokens
description:
Array of tokens in use.
The slice will only use the ones from `start` to `end`.
(This is more efficient than calling {@link Array#slice} many times.)

name: _start
description: Inclusive; index of first token in the slice.

name: _end
description: Exclusive; index of first token *not* in the slice.

name: loc
description:
Slice keeps track of changes to `loc` as sub-slices are made,
so most parser functions will call `tokens.loc` when constructing the {@link MsAst}.

name: size
description: Number of tokens.

name: isEmpty
description: True iff there are no tokens left.

name: head
description: First token.

name: headSlice
description: Slice of first token.

name: second
description: Second token.

name: last
description: Last token.

name: nextToLast
description: Second-to-last token.

name: tail
description: Slice of all but the first token.

name: rtail
description: Slice of all but the last token.

name: opSplitOnce
description: Splits on the first token satisfying `splitOn`.

name: opSplitMany
description: Splits on *every* token satisfying `splitOn`.

name: [Symbol.iterator]
description: Iterate over every Token.

name: slices
description:
Iterator over a Slice for every Token.
Assumes every sub-token is a Slice too; meaning this is a {@link Group.Block} slice.

name: map
description: Maps over every Token.

name: mapSlices
description: Maps over a Slice for every Token, as in {@link slices}.

name: src/private/parse/checks.js
checkEmpty
description: Throw a {@link CompileError} if `tokens` has content.

name: checkNonEmpty
description: Throw a {@link CompileError} if `tokens` is empty.

name: checkKeyword
description: Throw a {@link CompileError} if the token is not the expected keyword.

name: unexpected
description: Throw a {@link CompileError} about encountering an unparseable token.

name: src/private/parse/loadParse*.js
content:
// TODO:ES6 Recursive modules should work, so this should not be necessary.

import parseClass from './parseClass'
import parseExcept from './parseExcept'
import parseExpr, {opParseExpr, parseExprParts} from './parseExpr'
import parseSingle from './parseSingle'
import parseSpaced from './parseSpaced'
import parseSwitch from './parseSwitch'
import {load} from './parse*'

load({
	opParseExpr,
	parseClass, parseExcept, parseExpr, parseExprParts, parseSingle, parseSpaced, parseSwitch
})

name: src/private/parse/parse*.js
content:
// TODO:ES6 Recursive modules should work, so this should not be necessary.

export let opParseExpr
export let parseClass
export let parseExcept
export let parseExpr
export let parseExprParts
export let parseSingle
export let parseSpaced
export let parseSwitch

export function load(_) {
	opParseExpr = _.opParseExpr
	parseClass = _.parseClass
	parseExcept = _.parseExcept
	parseExpr = _.parseExpr
	parseExprParts = _.parseExprParts
	parseSingle = _.parseSingle
	parseSpaced = _.parseSpaced
	parseSwitch = _.parseSwitch
}

name: src/private/parse/parse.js
parse
description:
This converts a Token tree to a MsAst.
This is a recursive-descent parser, made easier by two facts:
We have already grouped tokens.
Most of the time, an ast's type is determined by the first token.
There are exceptions such as assignment statements (indicated by a `=` somewhere in the middle).
For those we must iterate through tokens and split.
(See {@link Slice#opSplitOnce} and {@link Slice#opSplitMany}.)

name: src/private/parse/parseBlock.js
parseBlock
description: Parse lines in a block and leading doc comment.

name: beforeAndBlock
description: Tokens on the line before a block, and tokens for the block itself.

name: beforeAndOpBlock
description: `beforeAndBlock` that returns `null` for missing block.

name: parseBlockWrap
description: Parse a Block as a single value.

name: justBlock
description: Parse a block, failing if there's something preceding it.

params.name: keywordKind
params.description: Keyword that precedes the block. Used for error message.

params.name: tokens
params.description: Tokens which should have a block at the end.

name: parseJustBlock
description: Parse a block from the end of `tokens`, failing if there's something preceding it.

name: src/private/parse/parseCase.js

description: Parse a {@link Case}.

name: src/private/parse/parseDel.js
src/private/parse/parseExcept.js
parseExcept
description: Parse an {@link Except}.

name: src/private/parse/parseExpr.js
parseExpr
description: Parse a {@link Val}.

name: parseExprParts
description:
Treating tokens separately, parse {@link Val}s.
This is called for e.g. the contents of an array (`[a b c]`).
This is different from {@link parseExpr} because `a b` will parse as 2 different things, not a call.
However, `cond a b c` will still parse as a single expression.

name: keywordExpr
description: The keyword `at` groups with everything after it.

name: src/private/parse/parseFor.js
src/private/parse/parseFun.js
parseFun
description: Parse a {@link Fun}.

params.name: keywordKind
params.description: {Keywords} A function keyword.

params.name: tokens
params.description: Rest of the line after the function keyword.

name: parseFunLike
description: Parse a {@link FunLike}.

name: funArgsAndBlock
description:
Parse function arguments and body.
This also handles the `|case` and `|switch` forms.

params.name: isVal
params.description: Whether this is a `|` as opposed to a `!|`

params.name: includeMemberArgs
params.description:
This is for constructors.
If true, output will include `memberArgs`.
This is the subset of `args` whose names are prefixed with `.`.
e.g.: `construct! .x .y`

types:
args: Array<LocalDeclare>,
opRestArg: ?LocalDeclare,
memberArgs:Array<LocalDeclare>,
block: Block

name: src/private/parse/parseKind.js
parseKind
description: Parse a {@link Kind}.

name: src/private/parse/parseLine.js
parseLine
description: Parse the content of a line.

name: src/private/parse/parseLocalDeclares.js
parseLocalDeclares
description: Parse locals (`a` or `a:b`).

name: parseLocalDeclaresJustNames
description: Parse locals with no types allowed.

name: parseLocalDeclare
description: Parse a single local declare.

name: parseLocalDeclareFromSpaced
description: Parse a single local declare from the tokens in a {@link Groups.Space}.

name: parseLocalDeclaresAndMemberArgs
description: For constructor. Parse local declares while allowing `.x`-style arguments.

name: parseLocalName
description:
Parse a name for a local variable.
Unlike {@link parseName}, `_` is the only allowed Keyword.

name: parseLocalDeclareOrFocus
description:
If `tokens` is:
empty: untyped focus
`:Type`: typed focus
`foo` or `foo:Type`: A normal LocalDeclare.

name: src/private/parse/parseMemberName.js
parseMemberName
description: Parse a plain member (`a.b`) or computed member (`a."b"`).

name: src/private/parse/parseMethod.js
src/private/parse/parseMethodImpls.js
src/private/parse/parseMethodSplit.js
content:
import {check, fail} from '../context'
import {isAnyKeyword, Keywords} from '../Token'

/** Split on a function keyword. */
export default function parseMethodSplit(tokens) {
	const baa = tokens.opSplitOnce(_ => isAnyKeyword(funKeywords, _))
	check(baa !== null, tokens.loc, 'Expected a function keyword somewhere.')
	const {before, at, after} = baa
	const kind = methodFunKind(at)
	return {before, kind, after}
}

function methodFunKind(funKindToken) {
	switch (funKindToken.kind) {
		case Keywords.Fun:
			return Keywords.FunThis
		case Keywords.FunDo:
			return Keywords.FunThisDo
		case Keywords.FunAsync:
			return Keywords.FunThisAsync
		case Keywords.FunAsyncDo:
			return Keywords.FunThisAsyncDo
		case Keywords.FunGen:
			return Keywords.FunThisGen
		case Keywords.FunGenDo:
			return Keywords.FunThisGenDo
		case Keywords.FunThis: case Keywords.FunThisDo:
		case Keywords.FunThisAsync: case Keywords.FunThisAsyncDo:
		case Keywords.FunThisGen: case Keywords.FunThisGenDo:
			fail(funKindToken.loc, 'Function `.` is implicit for methods.')
			break
		default:
			fail(funKindToken.loc, `Expected function kind, got ${funKindToken}.`)
	}
}

const funKeywords = new Set([
	Keywords.Fun, Keywords.FunDo, Keywords.FunThis, Keywords.FunThisDo,
	Keywords.FunAsync, Keywords.FunAsyncDo, Keywords.FunThisAsync, Keywords.FunThisAsyncDo,
	Keywords.FunGen, Keywords.FunGenDo, Keywords.FunThisGen, Keywords.FunThisGenDo
])

name: parseMethodSplit
description: Split on a function keyword.

name: src/private/transpile/ast-constants.js
content:
import {ArrayExpression, AssignmentExpression, Identifier, Literal, NewExpression, ObjectExpression,
	ReturnStatement, SwitchCase, ThisExpression, VariableDeclaration, VariableDeclarator}
	from 'esast/dist/ast'
import {member} from 'esast/dist/util'
import {throwErrorFromString} from './util'

export const
	GlobalError = new Identifier('Error'),
	GlobalInfinity = new Identifier('Infinity'),
	IdArguments = new Identifier('arguments'),
	IdBuilt = new Identifier('built'),
	IdError = new Identifier('Error'),
	IdExports = new Identifier('exports'),
	IdExtract = new Identifier('_$'),
	IdFocus = new Identifier('_'),
	IdLexicalThis = new Identifier('_this'),
	IdLoop = new Identifier('loop'),
	IdSuper = new Identifier('super'),
	LitEmptyArray = new ArrayExpression([]),
	LitEmptyString = new Literal(''),
	LitNull = new Literal(null),
	LitStrThrow = new Literal('An error occurred.'),
	LitTrue = new Literal(true),
	LitZero = new Literal(0),
	ReturnBuilt = new ReturnStatement(IdBuilt),
	ReturnFocus = new ReturnStatement(IdFocus),
	SwitchCaseNoMatch = new SwitchCase(undefined, [
		throwErrorFromString('No branch of `switch` matches.')]),
	SymbolIterator = member(new Identifier('Symbol'), 'iterator'),
	ThrowAssertFail = throwErrorFromString('Assertion failed.'),
	ThrowNoCaseMatch = throwErrorFromString('No branch of `case` matches.'),

	ArraySliceCall = member(member(LitEmptyArray, 'slice'), 'call'),
	DeclareBuiltBag = new VariableDeclaration('let',
		[new VariableDeclarator(IdBuilt, LitEmptyArray)]),
	DeclareBuiltMap = new VariableDeclaration('let', [
		new VariableDeclarator(IdBuilt,
			new NewExpression(member(new Identifier('global'), 'Map'), []))]),
	DeclareBuiltObj = new VariableDeclaration('let', [
		new VariableDeclarator(IdBuilt, new ObjectExpression([]))]),
	ExportsDefault = member(IdExports, 'default'),

	DeclareLexicalThis = new VariableDeclaration('let',
		[new VariableDeclarator(IdLexicalThis, new ThisExpression())]),
	LetLexicalThis = new VariableDeclaration('let', [new VariableDeclarator(IdLexicalThis)]),
	SetLexicalThis = new AssignmentExpression('=', IdLexicalThis, new ThisExpression())

name: src/private/transpile/context.js
src/private/transpile/transpile.js
transpile
description: Transform a {@link MsAst} into an esast. *

name: src/private/transpile/transpileExcept.js

params.name: needsErrorDeclare
params.description:
If there are multiple catches with different error names, each one must declare its own.
The common error (used by the compiled `catch` block) is IdError.

name: transpileWithElse
src/private/transpile/transpileMethod.js
transpileMethodToDefinition
description: Transpile method to a MethodDefinition in a class.

name: transpileMethodToProperty
description: Transpile method to a property of an object.

name: src/private/transpile/transpileModule.js
src/private/transpile/util.js
blockWrap
description: Wraps a block (with `return` statements in it) in an IIFE.

name: callFocusFun
description: Create a focus fun returning `value` and call it on `calledOn`, preserving generator/async.

name: callPreservingFunKind
description:
Call a function created by `blockWrap` or `callFocusFun`.
This looks like:
Funs.Plain: `(_ => foo(_))(1)`.
Funs.Generator, Funs.Async: `yield* function*(_) { return foo(_) }(1)`

name: blockWrapIfVal
description: Wraps a statement in an IIFE if its MsAst is a value.

name: src/private/util.js
allSame
description: Whether every element in `array` is equal.

name: assert
description:
Used to ensure that the compiler is programmed correctly.
If an assertion fails, it's a bug in mason-compile.
For errors in source code, see {@link check}.

name: cat
description:
Combine many values into one array.
Arrays are flattened and nulls are skipped.
So `cat([1, 2], null, 3)` is `[1, 2, 3]`.

name: flatMap
description:
Like `Array.prototype.map` but `mapper` should return Arrays,
which are flattened to a single Array.

name: flatOpMap
description: Like `Array.prototype.map`, but if `opMapper` returns null, that entry is skipped.

name: head
description: First element of an Array.

name: ifElse
description: Take a different action depending on whether `op` is null.

name: implementMany
description: Implement a method `methodName` on many types at once.

params.name: types
params.description: Object containing many types.

params.name: impls
params.description:
Keys are names of types in `types`.
Values are implementations of the method.

name: isEmpty
description: False iff there are any elements in the array.

name: last
description: Element at the end of an Array.

name: opEach
description: Do `action` if `op` is not null.

name: opIf
description: Create an optional value, which is `null` unless `cond`.

name: opMap
description: Call a function on an optional value, but only if it's not null.

name: opOr
description: If an optional value is `null`, replace it.

name: reverseIter
description: Iterate over an Array in reverse.

name: rtail
description: All but the last element of an Array.

name: tail
description: All but the first element of an Array.

name: toArray
description: Wrap value in an Array if it's not already one.

name: src/private/verify/SK.js
checkDo
description: This MsAst must be a statement.

name: checkVal
description: This MsAst must be a value.

name: markStatement
description:
This is an MsAst that is sometimes a statement, sometimes an expression.
Mark it using `sk` so that it can transpile correctly.

name: getSK
description:
Infers whether the last line of a module is a statement or a value.
Prefers to make it a value, such as in the case of a Call.

name: compositeForSK
description:
This handles the rare case where a 'for' loop is the last line of a module.
The error occurs if it looks like:
for
switch 0
0
break 1
else
break
Meaning that it can't be determined whether it's a statement or value.

name: SK
description: Statement Kind.

name: src/private/verify/autoBlockKind.js
src/private/verify/context.js
withIife
description: Can't break out of loop inside of IIFE.

name: withIifeIfVal
description: The value form of some expressions need to be wrapped in an IIFE.

name: src/private/verify/locals.js
src/private/verify/util.js
makeUseOptional
description: Mark a LocalDeclare as OK to not use.

name: makeUseOptionalIfFocus
description:
For Asts that use the focus by default, make it OK to not use the variable when it's the focus.
(If the user specified a name, they intended to use it.)

name: verifyEach
description: Verify each of asts.

params.name: sk
params.description: Optional SK of each ast.

name: verifyOp
description: Verify opAst if it exists.

params.name: arg
params.description: Argument to pass to _.verify. Usually an {@link SK}.

name: verifyName
description: Verify if it's not a string.

name: src/private/verify/verify.js
verify
description:
Generates information needed during transpiling, the VerifyResults.
Also checks for existence of local variables and warns for unused locals.

name: src/private/verify/verifyBlock.js
src/private/verify/verifyLines.js
verifyLines
description: Verifies each line, accumulating locals.

return.description: List of every new local from `lines`.
